newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil Paranagua/Santos sugar shipping conditions.
newsitem.headline: Brazil Paranagua/Santos sugar shipping conditions.

text.p: The Brazilian ports of Paranagua and Santos reported the following conditions for shipping sugar.
Vessels: Sampa loading 2,700 tonnes bagged sugar. Al Hafizu loading 13,500 tonnes bagged sugar. Rio B loading 14,000 tonnes using big bags. Jag Vishnu loading 25,000 tonnes bulk sugar.
Kitta loading 14,500 tonnes bagged sugar. Wrestler II loading 20,000 tonnes bagged sugar. Waiting to dock, four vessels to load using big bags and three to load bulk.
Road: 252 trucks carrying sugar arrived on June 26.
Loading: 3,354 tonnes using big bags, 3,638 tonnes bulk.

Vessels: Alan, Fratziz, Daiana P, Tong Cheng, Ar Raqib, Fulvia and Efrem each loading 14,000 tonnes bagged sugar. Tern loading 28,000 tonnes bulk sugar. Jurata loading 12,000 tonnes bagged sugar. Waiting to dock, three vessels to load sugar of which one bulk, the others unspecified. At Cargill private terminal, Woodpecker loading 16,000 tonnes bulk sugar. No vessels waiting to dock.
Stocks: 11,358 tonnes bulk in CODESP warehouses, no bagged sugar. Private warehouses already with bagged sugar but stock levels unavailable.
